user_review: Fantastic app, runs super well. Now supports PieFed as well which is awesome! no ads. It's great!
pull_request: fix(piefed): mark mentions read, save comments, view saved posts/comments Resolves #2135, #2134 issue_#2135: PieFed: error when marking PieFed mention as read [Describe the bug] This issue was originally reported in the Voyager Matrix chat by someone else, but I recreated it. I'm not able to mark a PieFed mention as read/unread. Clicking on it initially pops up a toast that says "Failed to mark item as read". It seems any mentions from Lemmy/PieFed/Mbin are all unable to be marked as read/unread. [To Reproduce] Steps to reproduce the behavior: [Expected behavior] App should be able to mark the mention as read [Additional context] You're using https://piefed.social/api/alpha/mention/mark_as_read when you should be using https://piefed.social/api/alpha/comment/mark_as_read to handle replies. issue_#2134: PieFed: error when saving comments [Describe the bug] When logged in to a piefed (.social specifically) account I'm unable to save/bookmark comments. App gives me a "failed to mark item as saved" error message [To Reproduce] Steps to reproduce the behavior: [Expected behavior] Commend would be saved and visible in my saved items.
author: aeharding

pull_request: Add swipe to unsubscribe, unfavorite Resolves #1482 issue_#1482: Unsubscribe gesture for Communities screen [Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.] I frequently start using Voyager from the Communities screen. Periodically reviewing the subscribed communities, sometimes I want to unsubscribe from one, or otherwise want to remove it from the list because of a lack of activity on it. Unsubscribing currently requires tapping on a community, then the "..." pea button, and finally Unsubscribe. [Describe the solution you'd like] Suggest a "swipe left" gesture on a community to offer an unsubscribe option. I believe this could be an Apollo Parity feature. My memory is getting fuzzy. [Describe alternatives you've considered] A Long Press option could be a suitable alternative. [Additional context] Currently using Voyager 2.9.1 on iOS 17.4.1. Thanks for reading, and keep up the great work!
author: aeharding

pull_request: Add backup/restore settings Resolves #366 issue_#366: Export/import settings to facilitate new installation If the app needs to be removed and installed again or if the app is used on a new device, a user might want to restore the settings of the original installation. pull_request: Fix feed scrolling to top when tapping webview status bar Resolves #1082 issue_#1082: iOS webview and tap to scrolltop [Describe the bug] When you open a post in a webview, if you tap the top of the screen and the browser is already scrolled up, the posts list behind the webview is scrolled to the top. When you return to the posts list, you are now at the top of the list and lost your previous post position. It often happends to me by mistake on iPad when trying to tap the "done" button and tapping too high. [To Reproduce] It's easier to reproduce on an iPad as the top bar has easier access [Expected behavior] The scrolltop function of the webview should not affect the posts list behind. [Device:]

user_review: This app actually is pretty good. So far seems to get about as much out of Lemmy as possible. Features are all there. The only problem I am having is getting to the comments. It might take 3 or 4 tries tapping and backing up to get to the comments. Most times it goes to the community instead. Let me know if I'm doing something wrong. You're doing great so far.
pull_request: Add URL searching, refactor linking, fix crash Related #608 issue_#608: Add support for opening Lemmy URLs Hoping for easier ways to use Voyager to open Lemmy URLs (from outside the app). I'm sure contributors are already thinking about this, but I didn't see this captured in an existing open/closed issue. Use cases: As of 1.4.0, I believe the best workflow is to use the (pretty great) search feature and use terms that appear in tht desired post. I am primarily using the iOS app now, so some of these are iOS-centric, but I'm sure some are valid for PWA and Android. This is an attempt at an somewhat exhaustive list of potential implementations (inspired by this Reddit post that helped refresh my memory). I imagine that some of these are trickier than others because Lemmy URLs aren't all from a single domain. I am no developer, so the compatibility column is my best guess. All of these describe what to do with a Lemmy post URL: I am happy to split this up into component issues if that's preferred over this monolithic one ðŸ™‚. Keep up the great work. I read every release notes entry. The pace of development is exciting to watch.
author: aeharding
